feed.title: Stories by Thomas Redz on Medium
feed.description: Stories by Thomas Redz on Medium

items.title: So you wanna list a property on the Airbnb market? Maybe this can help
items.author: Thomas Redz
items.description:
Using these insights from the Airbnb Seattle Data form 2016/2017 is it possible to extract some interesting data and optimize you next insertion on Airbnb.

Introduction

Airbnb, Inc. is an American company that operates an online marketplace for lodging, primarily homestays for vacation rentals, and tourism activities.

Listing a property on the platform is not as easy as it seems mainly because the high offer available in almost every city. So a new host that is trying to approach the market can find some difficulties in obtain clients which takes review to the property and contribute to its ranking in the listings. In conclusion, without the right approach it becomes really difficult to earn an income from the property.

To understand better the market I decided to analyze the listings in the 2016 Seattle market from a dataset on Kaggle covering Calendar Data, Property Data and Reviews Data. The aim of the analysis was to answer these questions:

What are the busiest times of the year to visit Seattle? By how much do prices spike?
What is the most expensive neighbourhood?
Do hosts with higher rating have higher revenue?
Which amenities of the house contribute more to the price?

The dataset is made by three CSV files:

  • Calendar, including listing id and the price and availability for that day
  • Listings, including full descriptions and average review score
  • Reviews, including unique id for each reviewer and detailed comments

What are the busiest times of the year to visit Seattle? By how much do prices spike?

Using the Calendar CSV file, I was able to plot the mean availability per house during the months of the year. As we can see from the plot below, January seem to be absolutely the month with low availability percentage compared to the other, with about only the 50% of the houses available. There seem to be also a little drop of availability on April and July. On the other hand, in December the houses are likely all available (about 81% of them).

And about the price?

The plot below shows the moving of the mean price in the listings per month. In there we can found what it appears to be a strange correlation between the price and the availability, with both of them moving together. Particularly, in January (which we have found has the small availability percentage) the mean price of the properties is the lowest of the year. The maximum price of the year is found in July/August, where the availability seem to have a discrete drop.

What is the most expensive neighbourhood?

The question I chose is based on a hypothetical new user who wants to invest in a property in the city and maximize its revenue when listing the property on Airbnb. While this analysis is quite easy, can answer the question in a great way and assure the future property holder that the position of the house will boost its income.

In the plot below we see that Fairmount park is the most expensive neighbourhood, with an average price of 350$ per night, followed by the Industrial district and Portage Bay (both around 250$).

Similarly to the most expensive neighbourhood, I decided to plot the less expensive ones. The results say that Roxhill and Olympic Hills are the cheapest place to stay (with relative prices of around 60/65$ per night).

Which amenities of the house contribute more to the price?

Last but not least, one of the most important things when looking for a house apart from the position is the amenities it offers. If you have to choose between two houses at the about the same price and only one of the two offers the swimming pool, a smart TV with Netflix or maybe a dishwasher, which one would you pick?

Sometimes people prefer to spend more on an expensive property with more amenities instead of a cheaper one without them.

In the last analysis I performed I intend to analyze which amenities of the houses contribute more to the price. That was probably the trickiest part of the work because the amenities are often written stacked and are quite similar between them (e.g. take Wi-fi and Internet, they are the same but are written in different ways). So after a long cleaning of the data I was able to see the different amenities of the listings in different columns. I combined them with the number of bedroom, bathrooms and the bed type provided in the listings CSV (because I considered them quite important in the price calculations).

After these operation I was able to build a Linear Regression model, which obtained a r-score of 0.5334145270329917 on 1146 values.

Now we just have to analyze how much the coefficients impact in the Linear Regression Model; the Dataframe below shows these values. As we can see, the major impact is made by the presence or not of the doorman, followed by the washer/dryer and finally by the number of bathrooms and bedrooms. One of the most interesting thing in this obtained Dataframe is the contribution of the row “Smoking allowed” in the price, which seem to contribute more than Breakfast and Cable TV.

Conclusions

In this article, we answered some questions that can provide the user interesting advices in order to optimize or start a new property listing in the Seattle Airbnb market.

  1. We first started to analyze the time where clients rent more properties and the time where prices are more high, getting January as the most rented month and July/August as the most expensive months.
  2. We then explored the neighbourhoods, extracting the most expensive ones and the less expensive ones, providing to investors some ideas about where to buy houses in order to maximize the profit.
  3. Our final analysis focused on which amenities contribute more to the price, in order to understand how hosts can modify their listings in order to increase the revenue. We observed that sometimes the smoking allowed tag can gather more money than the breakfast one.

The findings here are observational, not the result of a formal study. I want also to say that this analysis has been made sometimes in a superficial way, not removing outliers that can influence the mean or other obtained results.

These datasets can provide much more insights about the market so now it’s your turn to extract new informations and provide a new guide to successfully start a business in the Seattle Airbnb Listings!

To see more about this analysis, as well as other questions answered see the link to my Github available here.

To see more about this analysis, as well as other questions answered see the link to my Github available here.
